title: Federal Court Blocks California Law Banning Private Prisons
sub_head: Two judges on appeals panel say law stops Homeland Security Secretary from executing federal immigration law
body:
A federal appeals court ruled a California law that bans private prisons canâ€™t stand because it impedes on federal immigration policy.
The law, which went into effect last year, prohibits the state from entering and renewing private prison contracts, and bans their use after Jan. 1, 2028. It includes for-profit immigrant-detention facilities run by private companies on behalf of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.
